docs.snippet: A town council in Pennsylvania approved a motion Monday night to censure the town's mayor over racist posts on his Facebook page, including two depicting apes with captions referring to President Barack Obama and his family.

headline.print_headline: Town Council Censures Mayor Over Racist Facebook Posts
headline.main: Town Council Censures Mayor Over Racist Facebook Posts

docs.snippet: German prosecutors are again considering whether to press charges against Mark Zuckerberg and other Facebook executives for failing to staunch a tide of racist and threatening posts on the social network during an influx of migrants into Europe.

headline.print_headline: German Lawyer Makes Hate-Speech Complaint Against Facebook
headline.main: German Lawyer Makes Hate-Speech Complaint Against Facebook

docs.snippet: Lawyers for Facebook Inc on Tuesday sought to assure a U.S. judge overseeing lawsuits by victims of militant attacks in the Middle East that it took a "zero tolerance" approach to any communications that may promote terrorist threats or activity.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Tells U.S. Judge It Takes Terroristic Threats Seriously
headline.main: Facebook Tells U.S. Judge It Takes Terroristic Threats Seriously

docs.snippet: Two digital acquaintances, one in Israel and another in Afghanistan, collaborated to save a baby in Pakistan with life-threatening congenital heart problems.

headline.print_headline: Social Media Power: Saving Child With Heart Defects
headline.main: Unlikely Facebook Friendship Saves Afghan Baby With Heart Defect

docs.abstract: Afghan infant receives life-saving heart operation from Israeli charity Save a Child's Heart, thanks to international collaboration between people that is largely enabled by Facebook connections and other digital communcations.

docs.snippet: German data protection authorities on Tuesday ordered Facebook to delete data, such as phone numbers, it has received from its subsidiary WhatsApp.

headline.print_headline: Germany Orders End to Facebook/WhatsApp Data Sharing Project
headline.main: Germany Orders End to Facebook/WhatsApp Data Sharing Project

docs.snippet: It’s not easy for a computer, or a human, to decide what is an unbiased take on the world.

headline.main: Facebook and the Problem With News Online

docs.snippet: In collaboration with a charter school network, Facebook has developed a student-directed learning platform aimed at public schools.

headline.print_headline: Learning System Expands to Nearly 120 Schools
headline.main: Facebook Helps Develop Software That Puts Students in Charge of Their Lesson Plans

docs.abstract: Facebook and Summit Public Schools, nonprofit charter school system with headquarters in Silicon Valley, says almost 120 public schools will introduce free student-directed learning system in fall; Summit-Facebook system, called Summit Personalized Learning Platform, is in part attempt to build brand loyalty among students at early age.

docs.snippet: His campaign was marked by misogyny. His appointments aren’t much better.
As Facebook commands a growing share of advertising revenue, and ad executives voice suspicion, Facebook itself talks of cooperation.

headline.print_headline: Ad Industry Confronts the Rise  of Facebook
headline.main: At Cannes, the Ad Industry Confronts the Rise of Facebook

docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column describes besieged mentality of advertisers and advertising industry at annual Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity, where many are worried about so-called duopoly of Google and Facebook.

docs.snippet: Facebook's changes to its "Trending Topics" section are being questioned after it featured a false report about Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Changes to Trending Topics Questioned After Blunder
headline.main: Facebook Changes to Trending Topics Questioned After Blunder
